Content and Headers: application/json Content-Type verified (TC27).
Performance and Concurrency: Large dataset performance and concurrent request consistency covered (TC14, TC23).
Regression/Integration: Deleted tags included when requested; backward compatibility with no params; add/delete via other APIs reflected (TC16–TC19).
State Variations: Empty database behavior validated (TC25).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since, Cache-Control, or 304 Not Modified.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios to trigger/validate 429, Retry-After, or X-RateLimit-* headers.
Authorization Granularity: No 403 Forbidden case for authenticated user lacking permissions/tenant scope.
Query Parameter Validation Depth: Missing negative tests for invalid objectType values, case sensitivity, and non-boolean includedDeleted.
Enumeration Coverage: objectType enum not exercised broadly (only INVOICE and PAYMENT).
Error Response Contract: Error payload structure (e.g., code, message, type) not asserted across error paths.
Response Determinism: No assertion of a stable/specified sort order for returned tags.
Content Negotiation: No tests for Accept header handling (e.g., unsupported media types).
Pagination: Endpoint appears non-paginated; if pagination exists it is untested (confirm spec).
recommendations: Add caching tests: assert ETag on 200, 304 with If-None-Match, and correct Cache-Control/Expires headers.
Add rate-limiting tests: generate bursts to elicit 429, validate Retry-After and X-RateLimit-* headers.
Introduce 403 Forbidden scenario using an authenticated user without required permissions/tenant scope.
Harden parameter validation: negative tests for invalid/case-variant objectType and malformed includedDeleted; enforce strict enums.
Data-drive objectType coverage: parameterize tests to iterate all supported enum values applicable to account tags.
Assert error response schema consistently for 400/404/503/504 (fields and types).
Define and verify deterministic ordering (e.g., createdDate ascending) to ensure repeatable client behavior.
Add Accept header tests: Accept: application/json succeeds; unsupported types return 406 or documented fallback.
Clarify pagination in the spec; if supported, add tests for page/size and link headers; if not, document limits.
Strengthen TC24 by asserting observable outputs (e.g., log/metric/trace or a warning header) rather than only stating logging occurs.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/renameKey - Update a bundle externalKey

covered_items: PUT Valid Request: Success path returns 204 and persists new externalKey (TC01, TC14).
PUT Non-Existing Resource: 404 on unknown bundleId and when no bundles exist (TC04, TC15).
PUT Concurrency Issues: Concurrent updates to the same bundle are exercised so only one succeeds (TC17).
PUT Partial Update behavior: Extra JSON fields are tolerated and only externalKey is applied (TC09).

Validation and 400 errors: malformed bundleId, missing body, malformed JSON, missing externalKey, empty externalKey, missing required header, and key conflict on same account (TC02, TC03, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC08, TC11).
Header handling: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced, optional Reason and Comment accepted (TC02, TC14).
Authorization: Unauthorized or forbidden requests return 401 or 403 (TC12).
Dependency failure handling: Service unavailable returns 503 (TC13).
Non functional: Baseline response time under normal load is checked (TC23).
gaps: Ambiguous outcomes in several scenarios reduce assertion strength and traceability (TC10, TC12, TC16, TC17, TC18, TC19, TC20).
No test for 415 Unsupported Media Type when Content-Type is missing or not application/json.
No explicit verification that 204 responses have no body and correct headers for success and errors.
No idempotency test for renaming to the same externalKey value.
No assertion that other Bundle fields cannot be updated and remain unchanged when extra fields are sent.
No scenario confirming that a duplicate externalKey in a different account is allowed.
Error payload structure is not asserted for schema consistency across 4xx and 5xx.
Character set, trimming, and max length rules for externalKey are not defined with deterministic expected outcomes.
recommendations: Make all scenarios deterministic: define expected status codes and messages for length limits, character set, trimming, and concurrency. Replace dual outcomes in TC10, TC12, TC16, TC17, TC18, TC19, TC20.
Add a 415 test for wrong or missing Content-Type to validate consumes application/json.
Add an idempotency scenario where the new externalKey equals the current key and assert expected result.
Verify only externalKey changes: after a successful update, fetch the bundle and assert no other fields changed. Also try to send another field and ensure it is ignored or rejected.
Add a cross account test where the target key exists in a different account and confirm the update is allowed.
Validate 204 semantics: assert no response body and correct headers; for errors, assert Content-Type and consistent error schema.
Assert a standard error response format with code and message for 400, 401, 403, 404, 503.
Optionally validate audit behavior by checking that CreatedBy, Reason, and Comment are recorded in audit logs or history endpoints.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Retrieve bundle tags

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy path 200 with JSON array; combinations of includedDeleted and audit (FULL/MINIMAL) and their combination are exercised.
Empty Response: 200 with empty array when the bundle has no tags.
Path Parameter Validation: 400 for invalid UUID format and 404 for non-existent bundle.
Query Parameters: Invalid audit value handled (400) and unexpected parameters tolerated without breaking behavior.
Content-Type: application/json verified on success.
Security: 401 responses for missing and invalid authentication tokens.
Resilience/Availability: API down/unreachable (503/504) and slow dependency behavior tested.
Performance: Large dataset, concurrency, and resource utilization scenarios are included.
Regression: includedDeleted=false does not return deleted tags; backward compatibility without audit parameter validated.
gaps: Pagination: No tests to confirm whether pagination is supported or explicitly unsupported for large result sets.
Caching Behavior: No validation of ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control headers or conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) leading to 304.
Rate Limiting: No scenarios to trigger 429 Too Many Requests and verify Retry-After/rate-limit headers.
Authorization (403): No test for authenticated user lacking permissions (insufficient scope/role).
Audit default NONE: No explicit assertion that the default is NONE or that audit=NONE behaves correctly (e.g., absence of audit fields).
includedDeleted validation: No negative tests for non-boolean or blank values (e.g., includedDeleted=foo) and expected 400.
Enum casing/normalization: No checks for case sensitivity of audit values (e.g., full vs FULL).
Contract/schema: Tag object not validated against canonical schema (#/definitions/Tag), including audit fields per level and deleted-tag indicators when includedDeleted=true.
Error contract: Standard error payload structure (code/id/message) and headers are not asserted.
Content negotiation: No Accept header scenarios (unsupported types leading to 406).
recommendations: Add explicit tests for audit defaults: verify that omitting audit yields NONE semantics and add a scenario for audit=NONE with correct field presence/absence.
Add negative tests for includedDeleted with non-boolean/blank values, expecting 400 with clear validation errors.
Introduce a 403 scenario: valid token but insufficient privileges should return 403 with standard error body.
Add caching tests: assert ETag and Cache-Control on 200; perform conditional GET with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since and expect 304 when appropriate.
Add rate limiting tests: burst requests to trigger 429 Too Many Requests; verify Retry-After and any rate limit headers.
Clarify pagination support; if supported, add page/size boundary tests and navigation headers/links; if not, assert that pagination params are rejected/ignored and no pagination headers are present.
Add JSON Schema contract tests for Tag objects (including audit fields for FULL/MINIMAL and absence for NONE) and for error payloads.
Add Accept header scenarios: Accept=application/json returns JSON; unsupported Accept values return 406.
Enhance resilience checks to assert consistent timeout behavior and required observability (e.g., correlation/request ID in errors) if part of standards.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/plan - Retrieve plan for a given subscription and date

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy paths validate 200 and a Plan object when both subscriptionId and requestedDate are provided (TC01), plus permutations with only one or neither parameter (TC02, TC03, TC04).
Query Parameters: Broad coverage of valid, invalid, and mixed parameter combinations, including malformed UUID/date and extra parameters handling (TC05, TC06, TC07, TC08, TC14).
Error Handling: Not-found (404), invalid inputs (400), dependency failure (503), and data-integrity conflicts (409/500) are exercised (TC07, TC05, TC06, TC08, TC10, TC12).
Empty/No Data: Scenarios for no matching plan and an empty database are present (TC03, TC04, TC11).
Authorization: Unauthorized access is tested and returns 401 (TC09).
Boundary Conditions: Date at plan start/end boundaries is validated (TC13).
Security Hardening: Injection attempts in both parameters are rejected (TC17, TC18).
Non-functional and Regression: Performance under normal and concurrent load, regression fix verification, and backward compatibility are included (TC15, TC16, TC19, TC20).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No scenarios verify ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control, or 304 Not Modified with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since.
Rate Limiting: No tests to validate throttling behavior or 429 Too Many Requests with Retry-After; concurrency tests do not assert rate-limit responses.
Media Type and Negotiation: The story states produces application/json, but tests do not assert Content-Type header or behavior when Accept is unsupported (e.g., 406).
Schema Validation: Response is only asserted as a "valid JSON Plan object" without validating against the Plan schema (#/definitions/Plan) or required fields.
Ambiguous Outcomes: TC03, TC04, and TC11 allow multiple possible outcomes (e.g., 200 or 404, default plan or empty object), reducing determinism and making regressions harder to catch.
Missing case: Existing subscriptionId with requestedDate outside any effective period is not covered (should return a clear not-found or defined default behavior).
Authorization Depth: No scenario for authenticated but unauthorized user (403) if the API differentiates between missing credentials and insufficient privileges.
Input Normalization: No tests for repeated query params, URL-encoded values, or trimming/case sensitivity for parameter names.
Temporal Edge Cases: No tests for tricky but well-formed dates (e.g., 2025-02-29, DST boundaries) to ensure correct date parsing beyond format validation.
recommendations: Add caching scenarios: return responses with ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control; send If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to assert 304 Not Modified behavior.
Add rate limiting tests: burst requests to trigger 429 Too Many Requests and assert Retry-After and rate-limit headers; also verify normal bursts do not throttle.
Assert media type: verify Content-Type: application/json on success and test Accept negotiation (e.g., Accept: text/plain -> 406 or documented behavior).
Validate response schema: assert the Plan object conforms to #/definitions/Plan (required fields, types, enums) rather than only "valid JSON".
Make outcomes deterministic: refine TC03, TC04, and TC11 to a single expected status and body per product decision (e.g., 400 when neither parameter is present, or define the default plan behavior).
Add a negative case where subscriptionId is valid but requestedDate falls outside any active plan; assert a clear, single expected response (e.g., 404 with reason).
Extend authorization coverage with a 403 scenario for authenticated but unauthorized users if applicable to this API.
Add input normalization tests: repeated subscriptionId/requestedDate parameters, URL-encoded values, leading/trailing whitespace, and case sensitivity handling for query parameter names.
Include additional temporal edge cases: leap day, DST boundaries, very old/future dates, and ensure inclusivity rules for start/end dates are consistent across time zones.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/healthcheck - Put the host back into rotation

covered_items: PUT Valid Request: 204 No Content on success, empty body, and host state updated to in-rotation; idempotent when host already in rotation (TC01, TC02).
Authorization/RBAC: 401 for unauthenticated and 403 for insufficient privileges; missing auth headers handled (TC03, TC04, TC09).
Error Handling: 405 for wrong method, 503 when service unavailable, and transient failure with retry behavior (TC05, TC06, TC13).
Concurrency: multiple concurrent PUTs complete without race conditions (TC14).
Resilience/Robustness: extra headers and unexpected payload do not break the operation; response remains empty on 204 (TC07, TC08).
Performance: acceptable response time under load (TC10).
Security: header injection attempt does not compromise the system (TC12).
Regression safety net for previously fixed issue (TC11).
gaps: Content negotiation/headers: Story states "Produces: application/json" but there are no assertions on Content-Type for success or error responses; no tests for Accept header behavior (e.g., 406 Not Acceptable).
500 Internal Server Error: No scenario simulating backend/internal failures (e.g., database/IO errors) to validate generic >=400/500 mapping and JSON error body.
Rate limiting/throttling: No coverage for bursts leading to 429 with appropriate Retry-After headers.
Method matrix completeness: Only GET is used to assert 405; no checks for POST/DELETE/PATCH/HEAD/OPTIONS or that the Allow header lists supported methods.

Request validation ambiguity: The API specifies request body N/A. TC07 expects 204 even with a payload. Clarify whether payloads should be ignored or rejected; if rejected, add 400/415 scenarios and invalid Content-Type handling.
Idempotency over sequential repeats: No scenario calling PUT multiple times in sequence to explicitly prove idempotency and stable state (beyond "already in rotation").
Structured error responses: Tests assert presence of an error message but not a JSON error schema (code/message) or correlation/request ID for troubleshooting.
recommendations: Add assertions for Content-Type based on the spec: verify application/json on error responses and confirm behavior for 204 (often no body and Content-Type omitted). Add Accept header tests, including 406 for unsupported types.
Introduce a simulated internal failure to assert 500 responses with a JSON error body, including stable error schema fields.
Add rate limiting scenarios: burst requests causing 429 and validate Retry-After/backoff behavior.
Expand 405 coverage: try POST/DELETE/PATCH/HEAD/OPTIONS and verify the Allow header lists PUT (and any others) as appropriate.
Clarify payload handling. If payloads are disallowed, update TC07 to expect 400 or 415; add a case for invalid Content-Type leading to 415.
Add a sequential idempotency test: invoke PUT multiple times and verify repeated 204 responses and unchanged in-rotation state.
Define and assert a standard JSON error schema (e.g., code, message) across 4xx/5xx; include correlation/request ID if the platform provides it.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Retrieve invoice item tags

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios validate successful retrieval with minimal params, includedDeleted, audit=FULL/MINIMAL, and combined options; Tag schema asserted.
Empty Response: Case where the invoice item has no tags returns HTTP 200 with an empty array.
Query Parameters: Comprehensive validation for required/missing accountId, invalid UUID formats, invalid boolean and enum values, and graceful handling of unexpected extra params.
Error Scenarios: 400 for invalid IDs, 404 for not found (invoice item/account), and 503 for backend unavailability.
Authorization: 401 for missing/invalid token.
Security Hardening: SQL injection and XSS inputs handled without leakage.
Performance/Resilience: Normal and peak load response-time checks; regression for deleted tags visibility; integration with audit logging including failure mode.
State Variations: Empty and partially populated database behaviors validated.
gaps: Default Parameter Semantics: No explicit test proving includedDeleted defaults to false when both active and deleted tags exist; no test for audit default NONE (or explicit audit=NONE).
Ownership Mismatch: Missing scenario where invoiceItemId exists and accountId exists but they do not belong together (expected 404 or defined behavior).
Response Headers: No assertions on Content-Type=application/json per Produces, nor Accept negotiation (e.g., 406 when requesting unsupported types).
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/Cache-Control headers or conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since leading to 304).
Rate Limiting: No scenarios for throttling/429 with Retry-After under burst traffic.
Pagination: Not addressed; if unsupported, an explicit N/A confirmation or negative tests (limit/offset) are missing.
Audit Shape: While FULL/MINIMAL are checked, there is no explicit assertion of exact fields present/absent for each level and that NONE contains no audit fields.
Error Schema Consistency: Error response structure (code/message fields) not validated across 4xx/5xx responses.
recommendations: Add a scenario where the invoice item has both active and deleted tags and includedDeleted is omitted; assert only active tags are returned (default=false).
Add scenarios for audit defaults: (a) omit audit and verify NONE behavior; (b) explicit audit=NONE returns no audit fields.
Introduce a scenario where invoiceItemId and accountId are both valid but belong to different accounts; assert the documented response (likely 404).
Assert response headers: Content-Type=application/json and correct handling of Accept (e.g., 406 for unsupported media types).
Add caching tests: verify ETag/Cache-Control headers; perform conditional GET with If-None-Match to receive 304 when appropriate.
Introduce rate-limiting tests: burst requests result in 429 with Retry-After and ensure client backoff behavior.
Clarify pagination support. If unsupported, add negative tests with limit/offset to confirm they are ignored or rejected with 400; if supported, add paging scenarios.
Tighten audit assertions by checking precise field sets for FULL vs MINIMAL and absence for NONE.
Validate error response schema consistently for 400/401/404/503 (fields, localization readiness, correlation IDs if applicable).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/search/{searchKey} - Search accounts

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy path and backward compatibility return 200 with a JSON array (TC01, TC18).
Query Parameters: Individual and combined valid params (offset, limit, accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, audit FULL/MINIMAL) are exercised (TC02, TC03).
Empty Response: No matches and empty DB return 200 with empty array (TC04, TC05).
Validation/Errors: Invalid search key, pagination negatives/non-integers, bad booleans/enums return 400 with messages (TC06–TC08).
Authorization: Missing and invalid tokens return 401 (TC09, TC10).
Resilience/Availability: 503 for service down, 502/503 for dependency failure, timeout handling 504/200 (TC11, TC16, TC19).
Security: SQL injection and XSS attempts rejected; DB remains unaffected (TC12, TC13).
Robustness: Unknown/extra query params are ignored with normal results (TC14).
Performance/Scale: Large dataset pagination and concurrency with response-time checks (TC15).
Regression: Empty searchKey returns 400 (TC17).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag/If-None-Match or Cache-Control headers and 304 Not Modified flow.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No explicit verification of 429 responses or X-RateLimit/Retry-After headers under burst traffic.
Content Negotiation: No assertion of Content-Type: application/json header or Accept header handling (per Produces requirement).
Default Parameters: No explicit verification that default limit=100 and offset=0 are applied when omitted.
Pagination Edge Cases: No tests for offset beyond total results (should yield empty), limit=0, or maximum-allowed limit behavior; no check for deterministic ordering across pages.
Audit Enum: No explicit test for audit=NONE (default value) when passed as a query param.
Authorization Scope: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated-but-unauthorized roles (if applicable).
Path Param Encoding/Unicode: No tests for URL-encoded search keys (spaces) or Unicode characters.
Generic 500 Internal Server Error: Not exercised to validate the standard error envelope.
recommendations: Add caching scenarios: capture ETag on first GET, then send If-None-Match to expect 304; assert Cache-Control/Expires behavior.
Add rate-limiting tests: issue a burst to exceed limits and verify 429 with Retry-After and X-RateLimit-* headers; also verify no 429 under allowed thresholds.
Validate headers: assert Content-Type: application/json (and charset), and test Accept negotiation (e.g., unacceptable Accept returns 406 if enforced).
Verify defaults: with no query params, assert offset defaults to 0 and the number of items is capped at default limit (100); add explicit audit=NONE case.
Expand pagination edges: test offset beyond dataset (empty array), limit=0, and behavior when limit exceeds maximum (clamped or 400); verify stable ordering across pages.
Test URL encoding and i18n: search keys with spaces (john%20doe) and Unicode (e.g., Jöhn) to confirm matching and proper decoding.
If RBAC applies, add 403 Forbidden for authenticated users lacking permission.
Simulate generic 500 error via fault injection to confirm consistent error schema and logging.
Make scenarios atomic where possible (e.g., split TC02/TC03 steps into separate scenarios) to improve isolation, readability, and parallel execution.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/xml - Retrieve the full catalog as XML

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful 200 responses with text/xml and well-formed XML for no params, requestedDate, accountId, and both (TC01–TC04).
Empty Response: Both no catalog data (404/400) and empty catalog structure (200) are handled (TC05, TC15).
Query Parameters: Valid/invalid requestedDate and accountId, combined usage, unsupported extras, and max lengths are exercised (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC07, TC08, TC09, TC16).
Authorization: 401 for missing auth and 403 for insufficient permissions are covered (TC10, TC11).
Error Handling: No matching date (404/400), malicious input (400/422), service unavailable (503), and timeout (504) are tested (TC06, TC12, TC13, TC22).
Performance/Scalability: Large catalog payloads, concurrency, and peak load SLAs are validated (TC17, TC18, TC21).
Resilience/Reliability: Retry after transient network failure is covered (TC14).
XML Quality and Compatibility: Schema/well-formedness regression and backward compatibility are covered (TC19, TC20).
gaps: Rate Limiting: No scenarios verifying 429 Too Many Requests and rate-limit headers (Retry-After, X-RateLimit-*).
Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control, or conditional GET leading to 304 Not Modified.
requestedDate Semantics: No boundary/selection logic tests (e.g., date between versions selects correct effective catalog; exact boundary timestamps; future/past extremes; timezone offsets).
Account Semantics: No test for a valid-but-unknown accountId, or behavior when tenant-specific catalog features are disabled; cross-tenant isolation not verified.
Content Negotiation: No tests for Accept header handling (e.g., Accept: application/xml vs text/xml, unsupported types -> 406).
Generic 500 Error: No scenario for unexpected internal server error (e.g., DB exception) returning 500.
HTTP Method Constraints: No negative tests ensuring non-GET methods are rejected with 405 (and whether HEAD is supported).
Compression: No tests for gzip/deflate via Accept-Encoding and correct Content-Encoding in responses.
Determinism/Idempotency: No assertion that repeated identical GETs return identical payload/ETag when data has not changed.
Pagination: Likely not applicable for full-catalog XML; absence should be documented and asserted as non-paginated behavior.
recommendations: Add rate limiting tests: burst requests until quota is exceeded; expect 429 with appropriate Retry-After and X-RateLimit-* headers; verify recovery after window reset.

Add caching/conditional GET tests: capture ETag/Last-Modified on initial 200, send If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to expect 304; verify Cache-Control directives and ETag changes when catalog updates.

Expand requestedDate coverage: test dates exactly at version effective timestamps, between versions (select latest prior), far future/past, and multiple timezone offsets to ensure consistent selection.

Add accountId edge cases: valid but non-existent accountId (expected 404 or documented fallback), cross-tenant access isolation (should be 403), and behavior when tenant-specific features are disabled.
Test content negotiation: vary Accept header (text/xml, application/xml, */*); verify correct Content-Type and that unsupported types yield 406 Not Acceptable.
Simulate generic server failure to validate 500 Internal Server Error responses and error payload structure.
Verify HTTP method constraints: POST/PUT/PATCH/DELETE to this path return 405; optionally verify HEAD support and headers without body.
Validate compression: request with Accept-Encoding: gzip and confirm compressed response with correct Content-Encoding and decompression integrity.
Assert determinism: repeat identical GETs (same requestedDate/accountId) and verify identical body and stable ETag when no data change; different parameters should yield different cache keys.
Document and assert non-paginated behavior for this endpoint to close the pagination guideline as not applicable.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/block/{blockingId}/auditLogsWithHistory - Retrieve blocking state audit logs with history by id

covered_items: Valid Request: Positive path returns 200 with application/json and an array of AuditLog objects; schema verified (TC01, TC19).
Empty Response: 200 with empty array when no audit logs exist (TC02).
Not Found: 404 when blockingId does not exist and when DB is empty (TC03, TC17).
Path Parameter Validation: Malformed UUID handling and boundary UUID values covered (TC04, TC10).
Authorization: 401 for missing and invalid credentials (TC05, TC06).
Query Parameters: Unexpected/extra query params are ignored without altering the response (TC08).
Performance & Scalability: Large history and concurrent requests within acceptable limits (TC09, TC16).
Resiliency & Availability: Service unavailable (503), timeout (504), and retry on transient failures (TC07, TC20, TC13).
Security Hardening: SQL injection and XSS payloads handled safely without data leakage (TC11, TC12).
State Variations, Regression, and Backward Compatibility: Partial data states, regression fix validation, and legacy headers (TC18, TC14, TC15).
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination or links; if the endpoint does not support pagination, mark as N/A explicitly.
Authorization Granularity: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated but unauthorized/wrong-tenant access.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios to trigger/verify 429 and related headers.
Caching Behavior: No validation of ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since, Cache-Control, or 304 responses.
Error Contract: Error responses are not validated against a standard JSON error schema or Content-Type for 4xx/5xx.
Ambiguous Expectation in TC04: Status code is listed as 400 or 404; the spec should define a single expected outcome per case.
Content Negotiation: No tests for Accept header handling (e.g., non-JSON Accept leading to 406 or defaulting to JSON).
Internal Server Error: No scenario for unexpected 500 error handling.
Data Semantics: No explicit checks for ordering (chronological), uniqueness, and completeness of history entries beyond a generic assertion.
recommendations: Clarify and codify TC04: Split into two cases—malformed UUID should return 400; well-formed but non-existent UUID should return 404.
Add a 403 scenario using valid credentials without sufficient permissions or with a mismatched tenant to ensure proper authorization handling.
Introduce rate-limiting tests: burst requests to provoke 429 and assert Retry-After and any X-RateLimit-* headers.
Validate caching: assert presence/absence of ETag and Cache-Control headers; add conditional GET tests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) expecting 304 where applicable.
If the API supports pagination, add tests for limit/offset (or equivalent) and link headers; otherwise document pagination as N/A for this endpoint.
Assert a standard error schema and JSON Content-Type on 4xx/5xx; verify fields like code, message, and requestId are present and no sensitive data leaks.
Add content negotiation tests: Accept=application/json returns 200 JSON; unsupported Accept returns 406 or falls back per spec.
Add a simulated 500 Internal Server Error scenario (e.g., forced backend exception) to validate generic error handling.
Strengthen data checks: verify chronological ordering, absence of duplicates, and required AuditLog fields (user, changeType, createdDate, reason, comment) for completeness.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/priceList - Retrieve priceList for a given subscription and date

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful retrieval with subscriptionId and requestedDate (TC01) and with only subscriptionId (TC02); response 200 and application/json asserted

recommendations: Add caching tests: capture ETag or Last-Modified on a 200, then send If-None-Match or If-Modified-Since to assert 304 and proper Cache-Control and ETag headers
