results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/tags - Add tags to payment

covered_items: POST - Valid Payload: Successful creation with required and optional headers returns 201 and a JSON array of Tag objects (TC01–TC03).
POST - Validation: Path param UUID format, required header presence, and body schema (array of UUID strings) validated; invalid formats and nulls return 400 (TC06–TC07, TC09–TC10, TC17).
POST - Malformed/Invalid Payloads: Malformed JSON and unexpected fields return 400 (TC08, TC10).
Story errors: 404 for non-existent paymentId is covered (TC05, TC18).
Large Payloads/Performance: Maximum-size arrays and peak-load conditions are exercised (TC12, TC14).
Duplicate/Idempotency behaviors: Duplicate UUIDs in a single request and re-adding existing tags do not create duplicates (TC11, TC19).
Concurrency: Concurrent POSTs maintain consistent, de-duplicated results (TC20).
Security/Authorization: Unauthorized access (401/403) and malicious payload handling (400) are covered (TC15, TC16).
Service unavailability path (503) is covered (TC13).
gaps: POST - Server Error Handling: No scenario for unexpected 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., database/persistence failure).
POST - Duplicate Submission semantics across repeated identical POSTs (sequential): no explicit test for idempotency/consistent status on a second identical request.
Validation: No case for syntactically valid but non-existent tag definition UUIDs (unknown IDs) and the expected outcome (e.g., 400 vs 404).
Content negotiation/headers: No assertions for response Content-Type (application/json) per Produces, nor tests for 415 Unsupported Media Type on wrong request Content-Type.
Partial success policy: Mixed valid and invalid tag UUIDs in one array (e.g., one bad among good) not tested to confirm all-or-nothing behavior.
Response contract: Tag object schema is only partially asserted; no full schema/field validation against #/definitions/Tag.
Required header edge cases: CreatedBy present but empty/whitespace not tested; Reason/Comment length/character limits not exercised.
recommendations: Add a test to simulate a backend failure that yields 500 Internal Server Error and verify error body/contract.
Add a true duplicate submission test: POST the same valid payload twice sequentially and assert no duplicate tags are created and status code/response are consistent.
Add a scenario with valid-format but unknown tag definition UUID(s) to define/verify expected behavior (reject entire request with 400 or specific error).
Assert Content-Type: application/json on responses in success and error paths; add a test posting with an incorrect Content-Type to expect 415.
Add a mixed-validity array scenario (e.g., [valid, invalid]) to validate whether the API fails the request atomically or partially processes it.
Introduce JSON schema validation for the Tag array and Tag objects (required fields, types, and values such as paymentId and tagDefinitionId).
Add header edge-case tests: CreatedBy empty string/whitespace should be rejected; exercise Reason/Comment with max-length and special characters.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Retrieve invoice item custom fields

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful 200 responses verified for valid invoiceItemId, returning a JSON array of CustomField objects.
Query Parameters: Audit parameter exercised for FULL, MINIMAL, and NONE, default behavior tested, invalid value validated (400), and extra param handling covered.
Empty Response: 200 with an empty array when the invoice item has no custom fields.
Path Parameter Validation and Existence: UUID format enforcement (400), missing path id (400/404), and non-existent resource (404).
Authorization: Unauthorized access returns 401.
Operational Resilience: Service/database unavailability (503) and timeout (504) covered.
Security Negatives: SQL injection and XSS attempts rejected with 400.
Performance/Load: Large dataset retrieval and concurrent requests tested.
JSON Validity: Response confirmed as valid JSON.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No assertions for ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since, or Cache-Control headers; no 304 Not Modified flow.
Rate Limiting: No tests for burst traffic/429 responses or Retry-After headers.
Pagination: Not addressed. If unsupported, tests should assert absence/rejection of pagination parameters; if supported, add limit/offset coverage.
Response Headers: No explicit check for Content-Type: application/json (and charset) despite Produces requirement; limited Accept negotiation validation.
Schema Contract: No rigorous validation that each CustomField matches #/definitions/CustomField (required fields, types) or that error payloads follow the standard error schema.
Authorization Depth: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated users lacking permissions/tenant access.
Error Model Consistency: Tests check messages but not structured error fields (code, message, type, etc.).
Audit Defaults Consistency: TC01 implies audit info at NONE level; TC13 says no audit info unless set. Clarify and align expected default behavior.
recommendations: Add caching scenarios: capture ETag from initial GET, re-GET with If-None-Match expecting 304; assert Cache-Control/Expires and Last-Modified headers as applicable.
Introduce rate-limiting tests (burst of requests) to validate expected 429/Retry-After or document that rate limiting is not enforced.
Clarify pagination support. If unsupported, add a negative test proving pagination params are ignored or rejected; if supported, add limit/offset and boundary tests.
Assert response headers: Content-Type: application/json (and charset) and content negotiation (e.g., Accept: application/xml -> 406 if not supported).
Add JSON Schema contract tests for CustomField (per #/definitions/CustomField) and for error responses to ensure stable contracts.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for an authenticated user without sufficient privileges to access the invoice item.

Resolve audit default semantics and consolidate tests: ensure audit=NONE and omission behave identically; reduce duplication by relying on the parameterized scenario (TC05) and keep a single default test.
Expand path param edge cases (leading/trailing spaces, URL-encoded UUID, case sensitivity) to ensure strict UUID validation.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods - Retrieve account payment methods

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy path and key variations covered (withPluginInfo, includedDeleted, pluginProperty multi, audit=FULL/MINIMAL, combined) returning 200 with a JSON array.
Empty Response: Account with no payment methods returns 200 and an empty array.
Query Parameters: Broad coverage of valid combinations and invalid values (invalid audit, unknown extra param ignored); multi-valued pluginProperty exercised.
Path/ID Validation and Errors: Invalid UUID yields 400; non-existent account yields 404, matching story.
Defaults: Implicit defaults validated (no pluginInfo, no deleted methods, no audit when no query params).
Authorization: Missing/invalid token returns 401.
Resilience/Errors beyond story: 503 service unavailable, plugin service 502/503, network timeout, and retry recovery covered.
Security Negatives: SQL injection in accountId and XSS in pluginProperty rejected.
Performance: Large dataset scenario checks responsiveness.
Regression/Compatibility: Backward-compatibility without query params and prior pluginInfo bug regression validated.
gaps: Pagination: No explicit tests for pagination behavior or explicit confirmation that the endpoint is non-paginated (large dataset test does not verify paging headers/params).
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/Last-Modified or Cache-Control headers, nor 304 responses via If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios validating 429 Too Many Requests or Retry-After headers under burst load.
Content Negotiation/Headers: No assertions for Content-Type=application/json; no tests for Accept handling (e.g., unsupported Accept -> 406).
Schema Contract: PaymentMethod (and pluginInfo/audit blocks) schema not validated against the API definition; only high-level type asserted.
Authorization 403: No scenario for authenticated user lacking permission (forbidden) vs unauthenticated (401).
Boolean Param Validation: withPluginInfo/includedDeleted not tested with invalid values (e.g., withPluginInfo=foo) or explicit false to ensure proper parsing and defaulting.
Audit=NONE Explicit: Not tested when passed explicitly to ensure equivalence with default.
pluginProperty Semantics: Assertions are vague; no deterministic verification of expected filtering/behavior or forwarding to plugin; duplicate/ordering handling not asserted.
Produces: application/json in story not explicitly validated via response headers.
recommendations: Add pagination coverage: If supported, test limit/offset and Link headers; if not supported, add a scenario explicitly asserting no pagination (no Link headers) and that all items are returned.
Add caching tests: Verify ETag (and/or Last-Modified) is returned; subsequent GET with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since returns 304; validate Cache-Control is appropriate.
Add rate limiting tests: Issue burst requests to trigger 429, assert Retry-After/backoff behavior.
Validate headers/content negotiation: Assert Content-Type=application/json; test Accept negotiation and 406 for unsupported media types.

Strengthen contract testing: Validate response against the PaymentMethod JSON schema (including required fields) and pluginInfo/audit structures; verify deleted method indicators when includedDeleted=true.
Add authorization 403 scenario: Authenticated user lacking scope/permission should receive 403 (distinct from 401).
Expand input validation: Test withPluginInfo/includedDeleted set to invalid values (foo, 1, TRUE/False case), very long pluginProperty values, duplicates, and ordering.
Add explicit audit=NONE and explicit withPluginInfo=false/includedDeleted=false scenarios to confirm correct handling of explicit false/default equivalence.
Make pluginProperty behavior verifiable: Use a stub/mock plugin or known property contract to assert concrete filtering/behavior changes and that properties are forwarded; avoid vague expectations.
Clarify pluginProperty error expectations: Decide whether invalid/unsafe values are ignored or rejected (400/422) and update tests (e.g., TC18) to a single, deterministic outcome.
Augment performance/concurrency tests: Add concurrent request scenarios to ensure consistent 200s without unintended throttling and acceptable response times.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Remove tags from bundle

covered_items: DELETE Method - Valid Deletion: Success cases for removing all tags (no tagDef), specific tags, empty array regression, and bundles with no tags all return 204 with empty body.
DELETE Method - Non-Existent Resource: 404 for non-existent bundleId and 400 for invalid UUID format are exercised.
DELETE Method - Concurrency: 100 concurrent DELETEs validate no race conditions or data corruption; integration check confirms final state.
Query parameters (collectionFormat=multi): Multiple tagDef values, very large lists (1000), absence of tagDef, and partial invalid values are tested.
Header handling: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy missing → 400; optional Reason/Comment present; header injection (XSS/SQLi) validated with 400/422.
Resiliency/errors: Service unavailable (503) and timeout (504 vs 204) are covered.
Empty response semantics: 204 with empty body asserted in success paths.
Integration validation: Follow-up GET confirms tag state post-deletion.
gaps: DELETE Method - Soft Deletes: No verification whether deletions are soft vs hard, nor audit/history assertions tied to CreatedBy/Reason/Comment.
Idempotency on repeat calls: No scenario for sending the same DELETE repeatedly (after tags already removed) to confirm stable, expected status (e.g., 204 no-op or defined 404).
Error response contract: Not asserting Content-Type (Produces: application/json) and JSON schema/fields for 4xx/5xx responses; only generic “contains error message”.
Unknown/unenforced tagDefs: No test for valid-but-nonexistent tag definition IDs or tagDefs not associated to the bundle (expected no-op vs error).
Duplicate tagDef values: No scenario verifying deduplication and deterministic behavior when the same tagDef appears multiple times.
Content negotiation: No tests around Accept header handling or response headers for 204 vs error responses despite “Produces: application/json”.
Authorization granularity: 403 Forbidden (authenticated but insufficient privileges) is not covered; only 401 Unauthorized is tested.
Server error handling: No explicit 500 Internal Server Error scenario (e.g., database failure) beyond 503/504.
Tenant/multi-tenant headers (if applicable to auth model) and rate limiting (429) not exercised.
recommendations: Add soft-delete/audit verification: Assert whether deletion is soft or hard; if soft, verify flags and that deleted tags no longer appear in active queries; validate audit log entries reflecting X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment.
Add idempotency tests: Repeat DELETE after tags are removed and confirm expected status and no side effects.
Validate error response contract: Assert Content-Type: application/json and a defined error schema (code, message, details) for 400/401/404/422/500/503/504.
Test valid-but-unknown tagDefs and tagDefs not associated to the bundle to confirm expected no-op or defined error behavior; also cover the mix of associated/unassociated IDs.
Add scenario for duplicate tagDef query parameters to ensure deduplication and consistent outcomes.
Add Accept header/content negotiation checks and confirm no Content-Type is sent with 204 (or confirm documented behavior), while error responses include application/json.
Introduce 403 Forbidden scenario where the user is authenticated but lacks delete permissions.
Simulate 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., DB failure) to validate server-side error handling and messaging.
If applicable, add multi-tenant header coverage and rate limiting/throttling tests (429) under sustained load.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoicePayments - Retrieve account invoice payments

covered_items: Valid Request: Positive retrieval with required path param returns 200 and a JSON array of InvoicePayment objects (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC16, TC20).
Empty Response: Account with no invoice payments returns 200 and an empty array (TC07, TC17).

Query Parameters: Broad coverage of withPluginInfo, withAttempts, pluginProperty (multi), and audit (FULL, MINIMAL), including combinations and invalid/extra params (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC12, TC13, TC14, TC19).
Authorization: Missing/invalid token yields 401 (TC10).
Path/Resource Validation: 400 for malformed UUID and 404 for non-existent account (TC08, TC09); SQL injection attempt is rejected (TC23).
Security Hardening: XSS attempt in pluginProperty is rejected or sanitized (TC24).
Resilience/Availability: Service down handled with 503 or partial data; transient network failure recovery covered (TC11, TC18, TC25).
Performance/Scalability: Normal and peak load response time checks; large dataset scenario considered (TC15, TC21, TC22).
Backward Compatibility: No-query-params behavior preserved (TC20).
gaps: Pagination: No explicit verification of pagination semantics (e.g., limit/offset, next/prev links, page boundaries); TC15 is ambiguous and does not assert concrete paging behavior.
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control headers, or conditional requests (If-None-Match leading to 304).
Rate Limiting: No scenario validating 429 Too Many Requests and Retry-After headers under burst traffic.
Response Headers: 'Produces: application/json' not asserted via Content-Type header; Accept/content negotiation not tested.
Default/Explicit Parameter Behavior: No explicit test for audit default NONE or audit=NONE; no tests asserting withPluginInfo=false/withAttempts=false explicitly keep fields absent.
Input Validation Depth: No tests for invalid boolean values (e.g., withPluginInfo=maybe) or case sensitivity for enum/boolean query params.
Schema Validation: No formal validation against the InvoicePayment schema (including required fields, types, and conditional presence of pluginInfo/attempts/audit based on query params).
Error Payload Contract: While errors are asserted by message text, there is no validation of a consistent error schema (e.g., code, message, type) across 400/401/404/503.
Authorization Granularity: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated users lacking permissions (if RBAC applies).
recommendations: Add concrete pagination tests: retrieve first page, subsequent page(s), and last page; assert page size, total/next links (or explicitly assert all results are returned if pagination is not supported for this endpoint).
Add caching scenarios: verify ETag and Cache-Control on 200; send If-None-Match to assert 304 Not Modified; confirm proper Cache-Control policy.
Introduce rate limiting tests: simulate bursts to trigger 429; validate Retry-After and correct recovery after backoff.
Assert response headers: Content-Type=application/json; optionally test Accept negotiation behavior if supported.

Cover default/explicit parameters: assert default audit=NONE (no audit details present) and audit=NONE explicitly; verify withPluginInfo=false and withAttempts=false explicitly keep related fields absent.
Strengthen input validation: test invalid boolean values (e.g., withAttempts=abc), and case sensitivity for audit values (e.g., full vs FULL) as per spec.
Add JSON Schema validation for InvoicePayment objects to enforce required fields, types, and conditional inclusion of pluginInfo/attempts/audit sections.
Standardize error contract checks: assert consistent fields (e.g., errorCode, message, type, requestId) across 400/401/404/503.
If RBAC is applicable, add a 403 Forbidden test for a user lacking permission to access another account’s payments.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/pagination - List accounts

covered_items: Valid Request: Success paths with default/no params, offset/limit, boolean flags, and audit levels (FULL, MINIMAL) returning 200 and a JSON array.
Empty Response: No data and offset beyond range return 200 with empty array.
Pagination: Boundaries (offset+limit crossing end), large datasets (10k), concurrent requests without overlap, and limit > total records.

Query Parameters: Robust validation of types and ranges (negative/zero, malformed int/boolean), enum validation for audit, defaults (offset=0, limit=100, audit=NONE), extremes (int64 max), and combined parameters.
Authorization: 401 for missing/invalid auth; method constraint 405 for POST.
Error Handling & Resilience: 400 for invalid params, 503 for service/dependency failures, timeout simulation and recovery.
Security: SQL injection and XSS attempts rejected with no compromise.
Performance & Integration: Response-time thresholds under load; audit=FULL cross-checked with audit log; balance/CBA inclusion when requested.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No verification of ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since, or Cache-Control headers; no 304 flow.
Rate Limiting: No scenarios to trigger/verify throttling (e.g., 429 Too Many Requests and Retry-After).
Content-Type/Produces: No explicit check that the response header is 'Content-Type: application/json'; no Accept negotiation test (e.g., 406 for unsupported media types).
Authorization (Forbidden): No 403 Forbidden scenario for insufficient permissions (if RBAC applies).
Schema Contract: No validation that Account objects conform to #/definitions/Account (required fields and types); audit FULL vs MINIMAL field sets not asserted precisely.
Audit NONE Explicit: No test with audit=NONE explicitly set (only default via omission).
Paging Order and Continuity: No assertion of a deterministic sort order or sequential page consistency (e.g., offset=0,limit=10 then offset=10,limit=10 have no gaps/duplicates).
Unknown Parameter Semantics: Tests assume extra params are ignored, but the spec doesn’t state expected behavior; this could mask incorrect server behavior.
recommendations: Add header-focused tests: assert 'Content-Type: application/json'; exercise Accept negotiation (unsupported Accept -> 406) to meet 'Produces' and robustness expectations.
Add caching scenarios: check Cache-Control/ETag/Last-Modified presence; send If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to validate 304 Not Modified behavior.
Add rate-limiting tests: burst requests to provoke 429 and assert Retry-After/backoff behavior.
Validate schema: assert Account object matches the API definition (ids, keys, required fields, data types); explicitly verify audit FULL vs MINIMAL field sets.
Add explicit audit=NONE scenario to confirm parity with the default behavior.
If RBAC applies, add a 403 Forbidden test (valid auth but insufficient permissions); otherwise, document N/A.
Add sequential pagination test to verify stable ordering and no overlap/gaps across consecutive pages.
Clarify and codify behavior for unknown query params in the spec; update tests to assert either ignore-with-200 or reject-with-400 consistently.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/refresh - Refresh account payment methods

covered_items: Valid Request: 204 success paths covered with required header only and with pluginName/pluginProperty combinations; optional Reason/Comment headers validated (TC01–TC07, TC05, TC21–TC22).
Non-Existing Resource: Proper 404 handling for unknown account and empty database (TC09, TC27).
Input Validation: UUID pattern and length checks for accountId; unsupported pluginName and malformed pluginProperty; unexpected params handling (TC08, TC19, TC11–TC12, TC18).
No Data Case: Refresh succeeds when the account has no payment methods (TC06).
Concurrency Issues: Parallel refresh requests and load scenarios validate integrity and performance (TC23, TC14, TC29).
Dependency Failures: External gateway/plugin service down and timeout scenarios produce appropriate 5xx/504 responses (TC13, TC20, TC25).
Security: SQL injection and XSS attempts are rejected/sanitized (TC16–TC17).
Authentication: 401 for invalid/missing auth; missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy handled (TC15, TC10).
Data Consistency: Post-refresh consistency across dependent systems verified (TC26).
Large Inputs: Many/large pluginProperty values and limits handled (TC07, TC24).
gaps: Produces application/json is not asserted: no checks that error responses return Content-Type: application/json; Accept negotiation not tested.
204 semantics not asserted: tests do not verify that successful 204 responses have an empty body.
Idempotency/retry safety not covered: repeating the same refresh should not duplicate or corrupt payment methods.
Authorization vs authentication gap: no scenario for authenticated user lacking permission (expected 403).
Ambiguous expectations: several tests allow multiple possible status codes (e.g., 204 or 400/502/503/413), reducing determinism.
Request body handling unspecified: endpoint has no body; behavior when a body or wrong Content-Type is sent (ignore vs 400/415) is untested.
Auditability not verified: persistence of CreatedBy/Reason/Comment in audit logs is not checked.
pluginProperty collectionFormat edge case: comma-separated single param vs repeated keys behavior not tested.
Error schema not validated: structure/fields of JSON error payloads are not asserted.
recommendations: Add assertions for Content-Type: application/json on error responses and clarify Accept negotiation behavior (e.g., 406 for unacceptable media types).
Add a scenario confirming 204 responses have no body (Content-Length: 0) and no JSON payload.
Introduce idempotency tests: two sequential refresh calls yield 204 and no duplicates or inconsistent state.
Add an authorization test where a valid user lacks permission, expecting 403 Forbidden.
Make expected status codes deterministic per scenario (replace ranges like “204 or 400/502/503/413” with a single, spec-aligned code).
Add a test sending a request body or wrong Content-Type to confirm server behavior (ignore vs 400 vs 415) per API contract.
Verify audit logging persists CreatedBy/Reason/Comment using the platform’s audit/read endpoints.
Test pluginProperty passed as a comma-separated value in a single parameter to ensure the server either splits or rejects it per collectionFormat=multi.
Validate JSON error schema (e.g., fields like code, message) for 4xx/5xx responses.
Optionally, add rate-limiting/429 and Retry-After validations if the service enforces throttling.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Add custom fields to payment

covered_items: POST Valid Payload: Multiple happy-path scenarios (TC01–TC05) verify HTTP 201 and return a JSON array of created CustomField objects.
POST Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON (TC08), missing required properties (TC16), unexpected fields (TC06), and malicious payloads (TC14) are handled with 400 or sanitization.
Validation: paymentId UUID format enforced (TC10), required X-Killbill-CreatedBy header presence/absence (TC02, TC09), unsupported query params handling (TC17).
Non-Existing Resource: 404 for unknown paymentId is covered (TC11).
Authentication: 401 for missing/invalid auth token is covered (TC12).
Large Payloads: Near-maximum payload and 413 handling are exercised (TC15).
Server Error Handling: Dependency outage leading to 503 is covered (TC13).
Concurrency: Concurrent POSTs without data corruption are tested (TC19).
Performance: Response time under normal and peak load is verified (TC22, TC23).
Integration/Persistence: Created fields are persisted and retrievable; cross-system consistency checked (TC24, TC25).
Internationalization/Regression: Unicode preservation (TC21) and duplicate field names regression scenario (TC20).
State variations: Adding when no existing fields vs when fields already exist (TC03, TC04).
gaps: Duplicate submission/idempotency: No scenario posts the same payload twice to define expected behavior (dedupe, 409/422, or repeat create).
Server error 500: No simulation/assertion for generic HTTP 500 Internal Server Error and transactional rollback behavior.

Response headers/content negotiation: No assertions that response Content-Type is application/json (Produces), no Accept negotiation checks, and no 415 Unsupported Media Type tests for missing/invalid Content-Type.
Strict schema/data-type validation: No tests for wrong data types, empty strings, or over-length values for fieldName/fieldValue, or invalid/ignored objectType values.
Batch atomicity: No mixed valid/invalid items in the same array to confirm all-or-nothing vs partial success semantics.
Authorization/permissions: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated but unauthorized user/role.
Idempotency/retry semantics: No tests for idempotency keys or duplicate prevention on client retries.
Response metadata: No checks for server-generated identifiers or any expected response headers beyond status code; no validation that objectType in response is correct for the resource.
Empty request semantics: TC07 leaves behavior for empty array ambiguous; contract should specify expected status and be asserted.
Rate limiting/throttling: No burst tests for 429 Too Many Requests or documented throttling behavior.
Optional header validation: No boundary tests for X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment length/encoding/special characters.
recommendations: Add a duplicate submission test: POST the same payload twice to assert expected behavior (e.g., dedupe, 409/422, or allow duplicates) and document the contract.
Add a 500 Internal Server Error simulation (e.g., forced DB exception) and assert error payload format and that no partial records are created.
Assert response headers: verify Content-Type: application/json on success; add tests for Accept negotiation and 415 when Content-Type is missing/invalid.

Expand schema validation: send wrong data types, empty strings, and max-length boundary values for fieldName/fieldValue; verify invalid objectType is ignored or rejected and server sets correct objectType.
Add mixed-validity batch test: include one invalid CustomField among valid ones to confirm atomicity or defined partial-success behavior.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for an authenticated user lacking permission to create custom fields.
Define and test idempotency behavior (e.g., Idempotency-Key header) or document that the endpoint is non-idempotent.
Clarify and assert empty array behavior (TC07): decide on 400 vs 201 and make the test deterministic per API contract.
Introduce rate-limiting tests under burst conditions to validate handling of 429 or documented throttling policy.
Add tests for optional header value constraints (length, Unicode, special characters) for X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment.
Verify response includes stable identifiers for created CustomField objects (if applicable) and that they are retrievable consistently, with objectType matching INVOICE_PAYMENT.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/catalog/simplePlan - Add a simple plan entry in the current version of the catalog

covered_items: Valid Payload: Successful creation with HTTP 201 and confirmation string/URI for well-formed SimplePlan and required X-Killbill-CreatedBy header (TC01, TC02).
Optional Headers: Acceptance of X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment (TC02).

Invalid Payloads -> 400: Missing required header (TC03), missing required field planId (TC04), invalid currency value (TC05), empty body (TC08), malformed JSON (TC09), duplicate planId conflict (TC06).
Large Payload handling exercised (TC15).
Security validation: XSS/SQL injection rejected with 400 (TC18).
Authentication: 401 returned for unauthenticated requests (TC10).
Service error handling: 503 for catalog unavailability/degradation (TC11, TC24).
Unsupported HTTP method returns 405 (TC14).
Resilience: retry after transient network failure succeeds (TC16).
Performance: response within target threshold (TC17).
Catalog state variations: empty and partially populated catalogs (TC19, TC20).
Integration propagation validated when dependent services are available (TC23).
Concurrency: multiple concurrent valid creates succeed with unique planIds (TC22).
Boundary values: max string lengths and minimal allowed numeric values exercised (TC12, TC13).
gaps: Validation breadth: Only planId is tested as missing; other required fields (productName, productCategory, currency, amount, billingPeriod) missing cases are not covered.
Invalid data types/enums: No tests for wrong data types (e.g., amount as string), invalid productCategory, or invalid billingPeriod values.
Duplicate submission/idempotency: Re-sending the exact same request (client retry) behavior not defined/tested (e.g., second call returns 409 vs idempotent success).
Server error handling (500): Database or unexpected internal failures not simulated; only 503 is covered.
Content-Type handling: Missing or incorrect Content-Type (application/json) not tested for 415 Unsupported Media Type.

Response contract: No assertions on response Content-Type (application/json) and absence/presence/format of Location or equivalent URI header when 201 is returned; body being a valid JSON string is not verified.
Current catalog version semantics: Tests do not verify that the plan is added specifically to the current catalog version (and not to a future/past version).
Authorization scope: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated but unauthorized roles/permissions.
Conflict variants beyond planId: No scenarios for other conflict types (e.g., duplicate plan name in product, incompatible billingPeriod for product, unsupported currency for product).
Unknown fields behavior: TC07 assumes extra fields are accepted (201) but does not test the strict-rejection path if the schema forbids additional properties.
Numeric range validation: No negative/zero amount, excessive precision, or out-of-range amount tests.
Auditability: No verification that X-Killbill-Reason/Comment/CreatedBy are captured in audit logs or change history.
recommendations: Add scenarios for each missing required field: productName, productCategory, currency, amount, and billingPeriod omitted individually -> expect 400 with precise error messages.
Add invalid type/enum tests: amount as string/NaN, amount with too many fractional digits, invalid productCategory, invalid billingPeriod -> expect 400.

Add duplicate submission/idempotency test: send identical POST twice (with/without an idempotency key if supported) and assert only one plan is created; define expected status on the second call (409 or idempotent 200/201) and verify catalog contains a single entry.
Simulate internal failures (e.g., DB exception) to assert 500 Internal Server Error and error payload shape.
Test Content-Type handling: missing Content-Type and wrong Content-Type (text/plain) -> expect 415 Unsupported Media Type; also verify Accept negotiation if applicable.
Assert response contract on success: Content-Type is application/json; if a URI is returned, verify it is a valid URI string; if a Location header is provided, validate its presence and format.
Verify current catalog version semantics: after creation, retrieve current and previous catalog versions to ensure the plan exists only in the current version.
Add authorization test for 403 Forbidden: authenticated user lacking catalog-write permission should receive 403.
Add broader conflict tests: duplicate plan name within same product, conflicting pricing rules, unsupported currency for the product/price list -> expect 400 with conflict details.
Clarify and test unknown fields policy: add one scenario asserting rejection with 400 if schema is strict, or explicit ignoring behavior if allowed (and document).
Add numeric boundary tests: negative amount, zero amount, very large amounts near system limits, and rounding/precision behavior per currency minor units -> expect 400 or 201 per rules.
Validate audit trail: after a successful create, retrieve audit logs/history to confirm CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded correctly.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId} - Retrieve an account by id

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful 200 retrieval with default behavior and with supported query parameters is exercised (balance, CBA, audit).
Empty Response: 404 behavior covered for non-existent accountId and empty database.
Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of valid/invalid combos, defaults, conflicts, and unexpected params (including invalid audit, blank boolean, both booleans set).
Authorization: 401 responses validated for missing and invalid tokens.
Path Parameter Validation: Malformed UUID returns 400; injection and XSS payloads are rejected without leaking sensitive info.
Error Handling/Resiliency: 503 service unavailable, timeout behavior, transient network retry, and concurrent request consistency tested.
Performance/Large Payload: Large response handling validated against API limits.
Backward Compatibility: Older client headers scenario covered.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag/If-None-Match or Last-Modified and Cache-Control; no 304 Not Modified coverage for conditional GET.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios validating 429 Too Many Requests and Retry-After headers under high request rates.
Response Headers/Content Negotiation: No explicit assertions that Content-Type is application/json as required; no Accept/406 behavior checks.
Schema Validation: The Account object is not validated against #/definitions/Account; error payload schemas for 400/404/503 are not asserted.
Authorization (403): No coverage for forbidden access or role-based authorization, if applicable to this endpoint.

Query Parameter Robustness: Missing cases for boolean coercion/case sensitivity (e.g., 1/0, TRUE/true), audit value case sensitivity, and duplicate query params (e.g., audit=MINIMAL&audit=FULL) resolution.
GET Request Body Handling: No scenario for a GET with an unexpected body (should be ignored or rejected) if the API defines behavior.
recommendations: Add caching tests: capture ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control on 200, then re-issue with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to assert 304 and cache revalidation behavior.
Add rate limiting tests: issue a burst of requests to validate 429 responses and presence of Retry-After and any rate-limit headers.
Add explicit header assertions: Content-Type=application/json on success/error; send unacceptable Accept to validate 406 Not Acceptable if defined.
Validate payloads against JSON schema: assert the Account object and standardized error bodies match #/definitions/Account (required fields and types).
If RBAC applies, add a 403 Forbidden test for authenticated users lacking permission.
Expand parameter robustness: test boolean coercion (1/0, TRUE/true), audit case sensitivity, and duplicate query parameter handling.
Optionally test GET with a small request body to confirm server behavior (ignored vs. 400) as per contract.
Reduce redundancy by consolidating overlapping happy-path scenarios into a Scenario Outline with examples to simplify maintenance.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoices - Retrieve account invoices

covered_items: Valid Request: Success paths for GET with and without query parameters, including combinations of startDate/endDate, withMigrationInvoices, unpaidInvoicesOnly, includeVoidedInvoices, and audit FULL/MINIMAL.
Empty Response: Accounts with no invoices and filter ranges that match nothing return 200 with an empty array.
Query Parameters: Valid combinations, partial inputs (only startDate or only endDate), invalid combination (startDate after endDate), and unsupported parameters (ignored) are exercised.
Path/Resource Errors: 400 for malformed/oversized accountId and 404 for non-existent account are covered.
Authorization: Missing and invalid tokens return 401.

Robustness/Security/Resiliency: Injection and XSS inputs rejected; service unavailability/timeouts handled; large data/performance and concurrency consistency; regression/backward compatibility and integration inconsistency handling.
gaps: Pagination: No explicit verification of pagination mechanics (e.g., limit/offset, next/prev links) or multi-page retrieval; large dataset test mentions pagination but does not validate it.
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/Last-Modified or Cache-Control headers; no conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) and 304 handling.
Rate Limiting: No scenarios asserting throttling behavior (429) or Retry-After headers under burst traffic.
Authorization depth: No test for 403 Forbidden (valid token without required permissions/tenant) or role/scope-based access, if applicable.
Response headers/content negotiation: No assertions for Content-Type=application/json, Accept header handling, or 406 Not Acceptable.
Response schema validation: Invoice objects are not validated against the defined schema; field presence/types and structure are not asserted.
Audit parameter completeness: No test for audit=NONE default behavior; no negative test for invalid audit enum values (non-enum strings).
Input validation breadth: No tests for non-boolean values for boolean flags or invalid date formats (e.g., 2023-02-30, non-ISO).
Boundary semantics: No explicit tests that invoices exactly on startDate/endDate are included (inclusive boundaries) and no timezone edge-case validation.
Server error mapping: No coverage for generic 500 Internal Server Error and standardized error payload contract.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: validate presence/behavior of limit/offset or links, ordering stability, and retrieval across multiple pages; otherwise assert that pagination is intentionally unsupported.
Add caching tests: assert ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control headers; exercise conditional GET to validate 304 Not Modified behavior.
Add rate-limiting tests: perform high-QPS bursts to confirm 429 responses and Retry-After semantics.
Extend authorization tests: simulate valid token with insufficient permissions/tenant to validate 403 and error payload (if applicable).
Assert headers and content negotiation: verify Content-Type=application/json and behavior with various Accept headers (including 406 for unsupported types).
Validate response schema: enforce Invoice JSON schema (fields and types) and audit block structure for audit=FULL/MINIMAL, and absence for audit=NONE.
Expand input validation: test audit=INVALID (expect 400), boolean flags with non-boolean values, and malformed/out-of-range dates.
Add boundary tests: confirm inclusivity for invoices exactly on startDate/endDate and document/verify timezone assumptions for date-only inputs.
Verify defaults explicitly: with no query params, assert audit defaults to NONE and that migration/voided invoices are excluded.
Add resiliency test for 500: simulate backend or DB failure to assert correct status mapping and standardized error response fields.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/payments/{paymentId}/transactions/{paymentTransactionId} - Update existing paymentTransaction and associated payment state

covered_items: PUT - Valid Request: Happy-path updates return 204 and persist the new payment/paymentTransaction state (TC01, TC02, TC13, TC14, TC15, TC23, TC24, TC26).
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: 404 when payment or transaction is missing or mismatched, including empty DB and cross-payment transactionId (TC06, TC07, TC12, TC27).
PUT - Concurrency Issues: Concurrent updates on the same transaction with final state consistency are exercised (TC17).
Authorization: 401 Unauthorized when credentials are missing/invalid (TC11).
Input validation and error handling: invalid UUIDs, missing required header, missing/malformed body, and inconsistent state data yield 400 (TC03, TC04, TC05, TC08, TC09, TC10).
Operational resilience: backend slowness/dependency degradation covered with 503/504 and resilience expectations (TC16, TC22).
Security hardening: SQL injection and XSS payload handling validated (TC18, TC19).
Behavior with optional/extra inputs: optional headers combinations and extra query/body fields behavior covered (TC02, TC13, TC24, TC25).
gaps: PUT - Partial Update semantics: No explicit test that rejects unsupported partial updates unless allowed by contract; TC23 assumes only required fields are enough but does not assert rejection when mandatory state fields are omitted.
Idempotency: No scenario validating that repeating the exact same PUT results in 204 and no additional state changes.

Content negotiation/media types: No tests for incorrect Content-Type (415) or unsupported Accept (406), nor assertions that 204 responses have no body; error responses content-type/shape not asserted.
Authorization (RBAC): No 403 Forbidden test for authenticated but non-admin user lacking privileges.
Server error handling: No simulation/validation of 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., DB failure) with proper error envelope.
Audit trail: No verification that X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are persisted to audit logs/history for the payment/transaction.
State-machine depth: Limited coverage of valid state transitions and enumerations; only an invalid transition is tested (TC08).
Internationalization/encoding: No tests for Unicode/emoji or non-ASCII in headers/reason/comment/AdminPayment fields.
recommendations: Add an explicit Partial Update test: send only a subset of state fields when the contract requires more; expect 400 unless spec permits partial updates. If partial updates are allowed, document and add positive cases showing which fields may be omitted.
Add idempotency tests: perform the same PUT multiple times and verify 204 each time, unchanged final state, and no duplicate side effects/audit entries.

Add media type tests: wrong Content-Type returns 415; unsupported Accept returns 406; assert 204 responses have an empty body and appropriate headers; assert error responses return application/json with a stable error schema.
Add RBAC test for 403 Forbidden: authenticated non-admin user attempts update and is denied.
Simulate internal failures (e.g., DB exception) to validate 500 response and error payload consistency.
Verify audit logging: after a successful update, assert CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded in audit logs/history for both payment and transaction.
Expand state-machine coverage: add examples for valid transitions (e.g., PENDING->SUCCESS, PENDING->FAILED, SUCCESS->CHARGEBACK where applicable) and enforce allowed enumerations/constraints.
Add i18n tests: include Unicode/emoji and locale-specific characters in AdminPayment fields and headers to ensure proper storage and echoing without corruption.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/admin/queues - Get queues entries

covered_items: Valid Request: Default behavior and multiple valid combinations of query parameters return 200 with application/octet-stream.

Query Parameters: accountId, queueName, serviceName, minDate/maxDate, and flags (withHistory, withInProcessing, withBusEvents, withNotifications) are exercised individually and in combination; malformed UUID and malformed date yield 400.
Defaults and backward compatibility: Omitted optional flags default to true; regression around withHistory=false is verified.
Empty Response: Both an empty dataset and filters that match no entries return 200 with an empty body.
Error handling per story: 400 for invalid accountId and 404 when the accountId does not exist.
Authorization: 401 unauthorized access is validated.
Robustness and fault tolerance: 500, 503, 504, and recovery from transient network failure are covered.
Security hardening: Injection in queueName and XSS in serviceName are handled without leaking internal errors.
Performance and scalability: Large data volume and concurrent requests are tested.
Tolerance of unknown parameters: Extra/unexpected query parameters do not break the endpoint and default behavior is preserved.
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios validate pagination or result slicing for large datasets (e.g., limit/offset, next/prev links, total count).
Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since, Cache-Control headers, or 304 Not Modified responses.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No coverage of 429 Too Many Requests or Retry-After header behavior.
Authorization depth: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated users lacking admin scope/role.
Boolean parameter validation: No tests for invalid boolean values or case-insensitive handling on flags (e.g., withHistory=foo, TRUE/False, 1/0).
Date validation edges: Missing cases for providing only minDate or only maxDate, minDate > maxDate, timezone offsets (e.g., Z, +00:00), and out-of-range errors.
Binary payload verification: The octet-stream body is not parsed/validated to assert schema, record counts, or precise inclusion/exclusion of histories, bus events, and notifications.
Empty-string and whitespace inputs: Behavior for queueName="", serviceName=" ", accountId="" is not defined or tested.
Duplicate/repeated parameters: No behavior defined or tested when a parameter appears multiple times (e.g., queueName=...&queueName=...).
Error schema specificity: While documentation is referenced, there are no concrete assertions that error payloads contain consistent fields (e.g., code, message, status, requestId) across 4xx/5xx.
recommendations: Add pagination scenarios (if supported): limit/offset or page/size, first/middle/last page boundaries, invalid values, and presence/format of Link or X-Total-Count headers; if pagination is not supported, explicitly document that the endpoint streams all results.
Add caching scenarios: Validate presence of ETag and Cache-Control; send If-None-Match to assert 304 Not Modified; optionally test Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since behavior.
Add rate limiting tests: Generate a burst of requests to trigger 429 Too Many Requests and verify Retry-After and recovery behavior.
Add authorization depth tests: Use a valid token without admin scope to ensure 403 Forbidden with a consistent error payload.
Strengthen boolean validation coverage: Test invalid values (foo, 1/0), case-insensitive inputs, and blank values, asserting defined outcomes (400 or defaults).
Expand date validation: Test minDate only, maxDate only, minDate > maxDate (expect 400), timezone offsets, and boundary inclusivity; document accepted formats (ISO 8601).

Validate binary content: Parse the octet-stream and assert schema, counts, and correct inclusion/exclusion for histories, bus events, and notifications; verify headers like Content-Disposition if a file is returned.
Test handling of empty-string and whitespace-only query parameter values and define trimming behavior.
Test behavior with repeated parameters to define precedence or rejection (e.g., first wins vs 400).
Make error schema checks concrete: Assert fields such as code, message, status, and requestId across 400, 401, 403, 404, 429, 500, 503, and 504 responses.
